The series is a [[Spin-off (media)|spin-off]] of ''[[24 (TV series)|24]]'' which was created by [[Joel Surnow]] and [[Robert Cochran (TV producer)|Robert Cochran]]. Consisting of 12 episodes, the show follows the life of war hero Eric Carter, played by [[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]], using [[real time (media)|real time]] method of narration.<ref name="Hawkins"/> [[Miranda Otto]] plays Rebecca Ingram, the former head of the now revived Counter Terrorist Unit in [[Washington, D.C.]]<ref name="Otto"/> The series is scheduled to premiere on February 5, 2017, serving as the [[List of Super Bowl lead-out programs|lead-out program]] for [[Super Bowl LI]], and will later move to its regular time slot of Mondays at 8:00 p.m.<ref name="schedule">{{cite web |url=http://tvline.com/2016/05/16/fox-fall-tv-schedule-2016-24-legacy-super-bowl-51/ |title=Fox Fall Schedule: Empire Gets Lethal Companion, 24 Scores Super Slot, Prison Break Held to Midseason |publisher=TVLine |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |date=May 16, 2016 |accessdate=May 16, 2016}}</ref>
The series begins with Carter, an ex–[[United States Army Rangers|Army Ranger]] who has returned to America, and the trouble that follows him back, compelling him to ask CTU to save his life, and potentially stopping the largest terrorist attacks on American soil.
==Synopsis== After leading a mission to eliminate terrorist leader Sheik Ibrahim Bin-Khalid, Eric Carter ([[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]]), returns to the U.S. and finds out that he and his squad mates are targeted for assassination in retaliation for Bin-Khalid's death. With nowhere else to turn, Carter asks CTU to help him save his life while also stopping one of the largest-scale terror attacks on American soil. The events will take place three years after the events in ''[[24: Live Another Day]]'' and is set in [[Washington, D.C.]]<ref name="digital spy" /><ref name="location" />
==Cast and characters==
===Main cast=== * [[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]] as Eric Carter, an ex–Army Ranger who has returned to America and is determined to stop the terrorist attacks that may follow.<ref name="Hawkins"/> * [[Miranda Otto]] as Rebecca Ingram, the former head of CTU, and the wife of [[United States Senate|Senator]] John Donovan, who is running for [[President of the United States]].<ref name="Otto"/> * [[Jimmy Smits]] as John Donovan, a Senator who is running for President, and is husband to Rebecca Ingram.<ref name="Smits"/> * [[Teddy Sears]] as Keith Mullins, the ambitious and driven head of CTU, who previously worked under Rebecca.<ref name="Sears"/> * [[Dan Bucatinsky]] as Andy Shalowitz, a communication analyst at CTU who is trusted by Rebecca and is unhappily paired with computer analyst Mariana.<ref name="three cast"/> * [[Anna Diop]] as Nicole Carter, a nurse and Eric's wife.<ref name="Diop"/> * [[Bashy|Ashley Thomas]] as Isaac Carter, older brother of Eric who is angry at him for their bitter past involving Eric's wife, Nicole.<ref name="Thomas"/> * [[Charlie Hofheimer]] as Ben Grimes, Eric's former comrade in the Army Ranger unit who is now suffering from [[PTSD]].<ref name="three cast"/> * Coral Peña as Mariana Stiles, a bright, young, self-taught computer analyst and cousin of former CTU agent Edgar Stiles, who is paired with Andy.<ref name="three cast"/> * [[Sheila Vand]] as Nilaa Mizrani, the campaign director of Senator John Donovan.<ref name="Vand"/><ref name="ep102"/> * [[Veronica Cartwright]] as Margaret Donovan, Senator John Donovan’s mother.<ref name="cartwright&nakli>{{cite web|url=http://variety.com/2016/tv/news/24-legacy-casting-veronica-cartwright-laith-nakli-1201878357/|title=Fox Adds Two Major Cast Members to ’24: Legacy’ (EXCLUSIVE)|work=[[Variety.com|Variety]]|last=Wagmeister|first=Elizabeth|date=October 5, 2016|accessdate=October 5, 2016}}</ref>

==Production==
===Conception=== In January 2015, another installment of the ''[[24 (TV series)|24]]'' franchise was pitched by executive producers [[Howard Gordon]], [[Evan Katz]], [[Manny Coto]] and [[Brian Grazer]]. It revolves around a stable of supporting characters rather than [[Kiefer Sutherland]] as [[Jack Bauer]] in the lead role.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://variety.com/2015/tv/news/fox-tca-more-24-x-files-prison-break-executives-1201407936/ |title=Fox TCA: New Chiefs Talk More ''24'', Brand-Building and Destiny-Controlling? |work=Variety |first=Cynthia |last=Littleton |date=January 17, 2015 |accessdate=January 17, 2015}}</ref> In May 2015, Fox announced the continued development of a new version of ''24''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.zap2it.com/blogs/fox_developing_another_season_24-2015-05 |title=FOX developing another season of '24' |publisher=Zap2it |first=Andrea |last=Reiher |date=May 11, 2015 |accessdate=May 11, 2015}}</ref> In June 2015, Howard Gordon stated that a spin-off would feature a new young male lead, alongside a slightly older, more experienced, female agent. Evan Katz and Manny Coto are confirmed to return as writers and executive producers. It is confirmed that this spin-off includes the "real time" feature as Gordon says it is the tradition of the show.<ref name="writing">{{cite web |url=http://tvline.com/2015/06/01/24-spinoff-fox-new-character-2016-kiefer-sutherland/ |title=''24'' Spinoff at Fox Would Revolve Around a New Male Character |publisher=TVLine |first=Michael |last=Ausiello |date=June 1, 2015 |accessdate=June 2, 2015}}</ref>
In January 2016, Fox announced it had ordered a pilot for a spin-off series titled ''24: Legacy'', featuring a new cast, with no returning characters. The series retains the real-time format, however, consist of 12 episodes, using time jumps to cover the events of a single day. The two lead characters are a male military hero returning home and a female who is a former head of CTU.<ref name="pilot ordered">{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/01/15/24-pilot-new|title=Fox orders new ''24'' pilot, wants diverse actor to star|work=Entertainment Weekly|last=Hibberd|first=James|date=January 15, 2016|accessdate=January 16, 2016}}</ref> [[Stephen Hopkins (director)|Stephen Hopkins]], who directed the original ''24'' pilot and several first season episodes, directed the ''Legacy'' pilot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/fox-greenlights-prison-break-event-856203|title=Fox Greenlights 'Prison Break' Event Series, Orders '24' Spinoff Pilot 'Legacy'|work=The Hollywood Reporter|last=O'Connell|first=Michael|date=January 15, 2016|accessdate=January 15, 2016}}</ref> In April 2016, Fox officially greenlit the series with a 12-episode order.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://deadline.com/2016/04/24-legacy-star-lee-daniels-series-order-fox-1201744988/ |title=‘24 Legacy’, Lee Daniels’ ‘Star’ Get Series Orders By Fox |publisher=Deadline.com |first=Nellie |last=Andreeva |date=April 27, 2016 |accessdate=April 27, 2016}}</ref> Frequent episode director [[Jon Cassar]] will also return as director and producer for ''Legacy'', directing 6 of the 12 episodes.<ref name="cassar">{{cite web |url=https://twitter.com/joncassar/status/757784585388253184 |title=Its official, I'm happy to report I'm returning to the new #24Legacy as a director/producer. I'll be directing 6 of the 12 episodes. |publisher=Twitter |first=Jon |last=Cassar |date=July 25, 2016 |accessdate=July 29, 2016}}</ref> Sean Callery is set to return as composer for the series.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2016/06/01/sean-callery-to-return-for-24-legacy/|title=Sean Callery to return for '24: Legacy'|publisher=FilmMusicReporter|date=June 1, 2016|accessdate=July 11, 2016}}</ref> ''Deadline'' reported on May 5, 2016, that Nikki Toscano had inked a deal with 20th Century Fox, and will serve as co-producer on the show.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/05/nikki-toscano-overall-deal-20th-century-fox-tv-24-legacy-1201749385/|title=Nikki Toscano Inks Overall Deal With 20th Century Fox TV, Joins ’24: Legacy’|work=Deadline|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=May 5, 2016|accessdate=August 26, 2016}}</ref> Although previously reported that no former characters would appear on the show, producers hinted to the possibility that [[Mary Lynn Rajskub]] would appear on the show as [[Chloe O'Brian]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/08/26/24-legacy-chloe-season-1-mary-lynn-rajskub-fox/|title=24: Legacy EPs Hint at a Role for Chloe in Season 1: 'We Have Plans'|work=TVLine|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|date=August 26, 2016|accessdate=August 26, 2016}}</ref> In an interview with ''[[Digital Spy]]'', Katz revealed that the script for the first episode took eight months to write. He also revealed that future seasons of ''24: Legacy'' will only have 12 episodes.<ref name="digital spy" />
====Appearance of Jack Bauer==== [[File:Kiefer Sutherland 2 SDCC 2014.jpg|right|thumb|140px|[[Kiefer Sutherland]] announced that he wouldn't appear in ''24: Legacy'' as [[Jack Bauer]].]] In June 2015, Sutherland said, when asked about the future of Jack Bauer, "I am not coming back to do ''24''{{-"}}. Sutherland said that {{-"}}''24'' is such a great idea, that this could go on forever". Sutherland said he felt it was important to have a new cast to keep the series and he hopes to maybe have a cameo in the future.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.goldderby.com/news/9505/kiefer-sutherland-jack-bauer-24-live-another-day-emmys-entertainment-13579086-story.html |title=Kiefer Sutherland drops bombshell: 'I am not coming back to do ''24''{{'}} (Podcast) |publisher=GoldDerby |first=Marcus James |last=Dixon |date=June 12, 2015 |accessdate=June 12, 2015}}</ref> In September 2015, Sutherland seemingly ruled out any further involvement with the show, stating that he would "definitely not return in any way".<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-34402671 |title=Kiefer Sutherland rules out 24 return |publisher=BBC |first=Emma |last=Jones |date=September 30, 2015 |accessdate=September 30, 2015}}</ref> In February 2016, Sutherland said regarding about possibly returning to ''24'': "I've learned enough over the last few years to not say never. We were never going to do a season nine when we finished after the eighth season. I said we were done. So I'm going to just say we'll see." He also said regarding the ''Legacy'' pilot script that it is "really cool" and that he would be the "first person to watch it".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.24spoilers.com/2016/02/18/kiefer-sutherland-24-legacy-script/|title=Kiefer Sutherland says 24: ''Legacy'' script is 'really cool'|publisher=24 Spoilers|date=February 18, 2016|accessdate=February 18, 2016}}</ref>
===Writing=== In June 2015, Howard Gordon stated that a spin-off would feature a new young male lead, alongside a slightly older, more experienced, female agent. Evan Katz and Manny Coto are confirmed to return as writers and executive producers. It is confirmed that this spin-off includes the "real time" feature as Gordon says it is the tradition of the show.<ref name="writing" /> Katz stated in an interview that it took eight months to write the first script for the first episode. He stated that one of the difficulties was that "It had to meet people's expectations, which were high and should have been high."<ref name="digital spy" /> He also revealed that the show begins three years after the events in ''[[24: Live Another Day]]'' and will be set in [[Washington, D.C.]] The series will introduce CTU's national headquarters located in Washington, D.C. CTU offices located in [[Los Angeles]] and [[New York City]] have previously been shown on ''[[24 (TV series)|24]]''.<ref name="digital spy" /><ref name="location">{{cite web|url=http://www.indiewire.com/2016/05/the-case-for-why-fox-should-premiere-24-legacy-behind-the-super-bowl-290692/|title= The Case for Why Fox Should Premiere ’24: Legacy’ Behind the Super Bowl|work=[[IndieWire]]|last=Schneider|first=Michael|date=May 12, 2016|accessdate=August 28, 2016}}</ref>
In an interview with ''[[Newsday]]'', showrunner Howard Gordon talked about the conception of the show as he said:
{{cquote|Manny [et al.] had an idea that was not a '24' idea, but as we talked, we thought, wow, maybe we could roll up with this character who was based on a real story—the special ops team which killed Osama bin Laden, and then came back to the states, where their identities were obscured and had a tough time adjusting. That was the premise of the character, and we realized he could be interesting with that as the focal point.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newsday.com/entertainment/tv/24-legacy-showrunner-howard-gordon-talks-new-spinoff-1.12170165|title='24: Legacy' showrunner, Howard Gordon, talks new spinoff|work=Newsday|last=Gay|first=Verne|date=August 12, 2016|accessdate=August 26, 2016}}</ref>}}
During the 2016 [[San Diego Comic-Con]], the producers called the series "an expansion of the 24 universe,” rather than a reboot of the original series.<ref name="SDCC" /> The producers revealed that they had chosen a new main character rather than Jack Bauer for the series as they felt they "had exhausted the former CTU agent’s story". [[Executive producer]] Gordon commented that "The groundwork that started the series is that we all felt Jack Bauer told his story with ''Live Another Day''. Kiefer read the script after it was written and saw the pilot after it was shot and loved it.”<ref name="SDCC">{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/07/24/comic-con-2016-24-legacy-panel|title=Comic-Con 2016: 24: Legacy exists in same Jack Bauer universe|work=Entertainment Weekly|last=Abrams|first=Natalie|date=July 24, 2016|accessdate=October 9, 2016}}</ref> With a presidential election plot, the producers decided to be neutral in referencing [[United States presidential election, 2016|real-life presidential candidates]]. [[Evan Katz]] explained that "You never know who’s affiliated with what. We started writing it before it was clear who the frontrunners would be, so it’s really neutral in that way."<ref name="5 things" />
===Casting=== [[File:Corey Hawkins by Gage Skidmore.jpg|right|150px|thumb|[[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]] plays the male lead, Eric Carter.]] The role of Eric Carter, the male lead, was announced to be portrayed by [[Corey Hawkins (actor)|Corey Hawkins]] on January 25, 2016, following lengthy negotiations.<ref name="Hawkins">{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/01/25/24-legacy-corey-hawkins-fox-cast/|title=24 Legacy's 'New Jack': Walking Dead's Corey Hawkins to Star in Fox Reboot|publisher=TVLine|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|date=January 25, 2016|accessdate=January 25, 2016}}</ref> Hawkins was the only actor considered for the role, after casting director Lisa Miller Katz watched his performance in ''[[Straight Outta Compton]]''.<ref name="digital spy" /> At the same day, [[Miranda Otto]] was announced to have landed the female lead as Rebecca Ingram, the former CTU-Director.<ref name="Otto">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/01/24-legacy-sets-miranda-otto-as-female-lead-1201691684/|title=’24: Legacy’ Sets Miranda Otto As Female Lead|publisher=Deadline.com|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=January 27, 2016|accessdate=January 29, 2016}}</ref> Otto immediately accepted the role when she was offered the part, stating that her reason was that she wanted a role involving "that world of CIA and terrorism," similar to her role on ''[[Homeland (TV series)|Homeland]]''.<ref name="5 things">{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/article/2016/10/08/24-legacy-new-york-comic-con-what-we-learned|title=24: Legacy: 5 things we learned from the New York Comic Con panel|work=Entertainment Weekly|last=Li|first=Shirley|date=October 8, 2016|accessdate=October 9, 2016}}</ref>
[[File:Carlos Bernard.jpg|thumb|left|150px|''24''-alum [[Carlos Bernard]] will reprise his role as [[Tony Almeida]].]] In February 2016, several castings were announced. On February 16, 2016, ''[[Deadline.com|Deadline]]'' announced that [[Anna Diop]] had joined the show as Nicole Carter, Eric's wife.<ref name="Diop">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/02/anna-diop-24-legacy-cast-corey-hawkins-1201703759/|title=’24: Legacy’ Casts Anna Diop In Co-Starring Role|publisher=Deadline.com|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=February 16, 2016|accessdate=February 17, 2016}}</ref> A week later, [[Teddy Sears]] was announced to have been cast as Keith Mullins, the head of CTU.<ref name="Sears">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/02/24-legacy-teddy-sears-cast-fox-pilot-1201707798/|title=’24: Legacy’: Teddy Sears Cast As Head Of CTU In Fox Pilot|publisher=Deadline.com|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=February 23, 2016|accessdate=February 23, 2016}}</ref> Several days later, ''[[TVLine]]'' reported that [[Jimmy Smits]] had landed the role as John Donovan, the husband of Rebecca Ingram and a powerful U.S. Senator with higher political aspirations.<ref name="Smits">{{cite web|url=http://tvline.com/2016/02/26/24-legacy-jimmy-smits-cast-fox/|title=''24: Legacy'' Enlists Jimmy Smits|publisher=TVLine|last=Ausiello|first=Michael|date=February 26, 2016|accessdate=February 27, 2016}}</ref> In March 2016, it was announced that [[Dan Bucatinsky]], Coral Pena and [[Charlie Hofheimer]] had been cast for the show. Bucatinsky and Pena was cast as Andy and Gia, two communication analysts at CTU, while Hofheimer was cast as Marcus, Eric's former partner in the Army Ranger unit, now suffering [[PTSD]].<ref name="three cast">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/24-legacy-dan-bucatinsky-coral-pena-charlie-hofheimer-join-fox-pilot-1201714780/|title=’24: Legacy’: Dan Bucatinsky, Coral Pena & Charlie Hofheimer Join Fox Pilot|publisher=Deadline.com|last=Petski|first=Denise|date=March 4, 2016|accessdate=March 5, 2016}}</ref> A few days later, [[Bashy|Ashley Thomas]] was announced to been cast as Isaac Carter, Eric's older brother.<ref name="Thomas">{{cite web|url=http://deadline.com/2016/03/24-legacy-ashley-thomas-cast-fox-reboot-24-pilot-1201717393/|title=’24: Legacy’: Ashley Thomas Set As Lead In Fox Reboot|publisher=Deadline.com|last=Petski|first=Denise|date=March 9, 2016|accessdate=March 9, 2016}}</ref>
''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' announced on March 9, 2016, that Zayne Emory had been cast as Drew Phelps, a junior at Marshall High School, who has a crush on Amira.<ref name="zayne emory" /> [[Sheila Vand]] was cast as Nilaa Mizrani, the campaign director of Sen.
